radioGroup.prompt: For embedded clause Yes/No questions, does your language have one or more Yes/No question marker particles, words or complementizers?
radioGroup.radio: Yes, like whether and if in English
No, it is a clitic which attaches to another word

radioGroup.prompt: Where does the Yes/No question marker occur with respect to the rest of the embedded question?
Can all the Yes/No question markers appear on either side of the question?
radioGroup.radio: No, there are separate sets for each side

radioGroup.prompt: Can the Yes/No question markers appear on both sides in the question?
radioGroup.radio: No, only on one side or the other
Yes, and they must appear on both sides
Yes, they may appear on both sides, but only the one in initial position is required

radioGroup.prompt: May a different Yes/No question marker also occur only in final position?

radioGroup.radio: Yes, they may appear on both sides, but only the one in final position is required

radioGroup.prompt: May a different Yes/No question marker also occur only in initial position?

radioGroup.radio: No, but an auxiliary is fronted

radioGroup.prompt: Where does the auxiliary occur with respect to the rest of the question?

radioGroup.radio: No, there is no marker or word order change in embedded clauseYes/No questions, just a difference in intonation or tone or other non-syntactic marking

form.instruction: You need to write a CC table pre-pass to separate the clitic so that it stands alone and also make a root entry for this clitic in your lexicon. Give the entry the category C, or add the feature C to the feature line to change the category for the syntax. If a different marker or method of formation is used in main clause questions, add the feature -root to this entry. If this same marker is used in main clause questions, no additional feature is needed.

In the lexicon, if this word does not already have the category C, add the feature C to the feature line to change the category for the syntax. If a different marker or method of formation is used in main clause questions, add the feature -root to this entry. If this same marker is used in main clause questions, no additional feature is needed.

In the lexicon, mark those markers which can only occur initially with the feature CP-initial and those which can only occur finally with the feature CP-final. Do not enter either feature on any markers which can occur on either side.
